TopicTitle: Can a satalite look though a window?

Articles.Content:
Here's a question, can a satalite in orbit, look through a window? Let me elaborate...

I am in a plain, flat (a spherical body, like earth, but completely blank, no mountains, no ridges, it's a perfect sphere the size of earth) and I am in a house. The house has two windows, one in front of me, the other behind me. I look to the horizon, and THEORETICALLY, if I could see far enough, I would see the probe in orbit.

The question is, since there is nothing obstructing its view, if it got in the right spot, could it see through the window to see me, AND the other window beyond me, even if it's for a microsecond. Could it be done?

Anyway, anyone got anything to say about the Xenon Powered Solar sails?

I cam up with an idea.... Is Xenon Gas engine powered Solar sails possible? A solar sail that is both pushed by the solar winds AND a xenon gas engine? Is it even possible??

A solar sail being pushed by a xenon thruster on the same spacecraft is like a sailboat whose sail is being blowed by an electric fan placed on its stern. Not only this will not work, it will look ridiculous.

Note the bolded condition. Falsify this, and you have a setup like this:

A solar sail is optimized for light pressure, not high-speed streams of ion, so let us swap the Xenon thruster with a laser emitter. Better yet, let's use a fixed laser battery on Terra, so we can use arbitrarily large amounts of power(as much as the utility company is willing to squeeze). Then, install a photon sail on the spacecraft optimized for a narrow band of EM wave (say, microwave), and adjust the laser battery accordingly. Install satellites carrying mirrors to ensure the laser works wherever the spacecraft is. After the aforementioned spacecraft reaches LEO and is near the maneuver node, open the sails, aim the laser battery and mirrors, and fire away.

This is how the spaceship ISV Venture Star left Earth.

I cam up with an idea.... Is Xenon Gas engine powered Solar sails possible? A solar sail that is both pushed by the solar winds AND a xenon gas engine? Is it even possible??

no, of course not. The craft would not gain anything from the engine if it is weaker than the force exerted by the solar wind, nothing from the sail if the force exerted by the solar wind is weaker than that generated by the engine.

The combination just adds mass, making the entire contraption worse than alternatives using one or the other.

"The craft would not gain anything from the engine if it is weaker than the force exerted by the solar wind."

AFAIK it would. But that's assuming the sail is self holding/rigid. If the sail is not rigid, it may unfold and become useless as acceleration from the ion engine overcomes it. If it is rigid (or enough strength from the solar wind), it will get a little boost from the ion engine and the solar wind.

Similar to this I would guess: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motorsailer
